titleStmt.title: George T. Angell to James W. Tate
CWG2676

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Boston Mass. Jan 29th 1862
Hon Jas W. Tate.
Assistant Secretary
of State of Kentucky.
Dear Sir,

I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your favor of Jan 24th announcing that my commission, as Commisssioner of Kentucky, in this City, terminates on March 8th and will be renewed upon forwarding the fee of $5 -- I accordingly Enclose the fee. with the request that my commission be renewed, and always happy to serve you in Boston.

Am
Very Respectfully
Your Ob't Serv't
Geo. T. Angell.
P. S. Perhaps my commission can be dated March 8th /62

Massachusetts
Comr. of Deeds
Geo. T. Angell
Boston
